node.title: How Can I Stay Me in a Workplace Full of Suits?
node.alt: Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg in her chambers in 2012.
node.description: A law student seeks advice on what to wear to work.
node.content: ["As Elle Woods might say, \u201cWhat does a lawyer look like?\u201d", "Not that I am advocating her style, which is clearly not yours. But rather, that these days there is a lot more wiggle room than there used to be for merging personal and professional dress. Official office dress codes have mostly gone the way of the dodo, as the power of the individual and the right to equality has come to the fore. (The pandemic and more than a year of WFH helped, too.)", "After all, the story of office dress codes \u2014 or school dress codes or any dress code, really \u2014 is the story of the social contract, the tension between the individual and the group. How much do you owe your employer to \u201cfit in\u201d and \u201crepresent\u201d them, and how much does the company owe you the freedom to be yourself?", "Increasingly, the balance of power has shifted away from the man in the gray flannel suit. At the same time, law is one of the most traditional sectors. (Even more than banking does, it still places a premium on the tie.) And as a new employee, you want the focus on your work, not your unexpected outfits; on your intellectual nimbleness, not the nimbleness of your sneakers. You want to be taken seriously, so a joke tee is probably not a good idea.", "But that doesn\u2019t mean you can\u2019t push the boundaries. As to where to start, I have one word for you: rental. It\u2019s not necessarily cheap, but it\u2019s a more sustainable and economic approach to experimentation than an actual purchase. Besides, if you find something perfect, many companies offer rent-to-buy plans. You may be surprised about what feels natural.", "The most famous name in the field is, of course, Rent the Runway \u2014 in October, it went public at a valuation of $1.7 billion \u2014 but it is far from the only resource. Check out Vince.unfold, Nuuly and Banana Republic\u2019s Style Passport.", "Then look for a great oversize trouser suit. Or, if you don\u2019t want to commit to a suit, find a blazer in an interesting fabric and team it with dark denim. (Stay away from jeans that are faded or ripped.)", "Instead of a graphic T-shirt, maybe try a striped one, or one with a different pattern. If you want, swap the sneakers for lace-ups (ideally with blocky heels for some height). And avoid the briefcase \u2014 go for a cool leather bag. Accessories are a great place to let personality come through. Just think of Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsberg.", "And remember: When Supreme Court Justice Elena Kagan became the first female solicitor general in 2009, tradition still demanded that the person fulfilling that role appear in court in \u2026 a morning coat. She discussed the outdated convention with her fellow lawyers, and chose instead to wear a dark trouser suit and light blue blouse, setting a new precedent. You can do the same.", "Every week on Open Thread, Vanessa will answer a reader\u2019s fashion-related question, which you can send to her anytime via email or Twitter. Questions are edited and condensed."]
